title: Typeface for logo
content:
Hi all,

I am in the market for a new typeface, its for my own business, I own a web design company.

I have some shapes in my head, I know I will probably get slated for this, but at the minute, the closest I can find is actually the logo for a bank:

[http://www.barclaycard.co.uk/\_images/header/logo\_alt.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023213202/http:/www.barclaycard.co.uk/_images/header/logo_alt.gif "http://www.barclaycard.co.uk/\_images/header/logo\_alt.gif")

I believe the type is a custom font, by the bloke who made Arial of all people. Anyway, what I like about it is that it is both curvy, yet not too playful, gets that's the sort of thing I am looking for.

Can anyone make any suggestions?

Thanks
author: reboot

comments.content:
Effra from Dalton Maag comes to mind. Half way between Avenir, Proxima, and work he’s done for Tote

[http://www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/effra](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023213202/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/effra "http://www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/effra")  
 [http://www.daltonmaag.com/about/modification/case\_studies/tote.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023213202/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/about/modification/case_studies/tote.html "http://www.daltonmaag.com/about/modification/case\_studies/tote.html")
